document_title: Congenital heart disease: Signs of recognition, screening and treatment
subsection_name: benh-tim-bam-sinh.json_8_How to prevent congenital heart disease?
subsection_content:
According to statistics from the Ministry of Health, each year our country has about 10,000 - 12,000 children with congenital heart diseases, however only 6,000 children receive surgical treatment, the rest are in the waiting stage or have died before surgery. detection. Therefore, proactively taking preventive measures early will help children avoid the dangers caused by the disease.
To proactively prevent congenital heart defects in children, right from the time of planning pregnancy, mothers need to:
Full list and consult your doctor about the medications you are taking.; In case the mother has diabetes, it is necessary to develop a plan to monitor and control blood sugar levels.; If there is a family history of congenital heart disease, consult your doctor about genetic screening.; Get vaccinated against Rubella and measles before pregnancy.
Women need to complete the necessary vaccinations before planning to become pregnant
During pregnancy, mothers are not allowed to drink alcohol, smoke cigarettes and take drugs without a doctor's prescription, especially in the first 3 months of pregnancy. Consult your doctor about the dosage of folic acid that can be taken during pregnancy and continuously to prevent diseases in the newborn.
Children with congenital heart disease can still be vaccinated with most vaccines to prevent infectious diseases. Please consult and advise your doctor to have a suitable vaccination regimen for your child.
